intro.description: This cheat sheet will guide you through the steps of creating structured data to be used in a workflow model.

item.title: Create new Structured Data Type for Model ACME
item.description:
First we create new structured data types for the ACME Workflow Model:
1. In the Outline view right-click Structured Types.
2. Select Composite.
Now the newly created composite type is visible in the Structured Types tree.

item.title: Define the Structured Data Type Product
item.description:
Now we define the structured data type Product:
1. Open the properties dialog of the new composite type.
2. In the General part name the new structured type Product.
3. Go to the Structured Type Definition.
4. In the name entry of the table enter Name.
5. Click in the type entry and choose the proposed type string.
6. Leave the cardinality as Exactly one.
5. In the same way enter the following composite types:

subitem.label: Add an element with name "Synopsis", type "string" and cardinality "Exactly one".
Add an element with name "State", type "string" and cardinality "Exactly one".
Add an element with name "Analysis", type "string" and cardinality "Exactly one".

item.title: Define the Structured Data Type Customer
item.description:
1. Again create a new composite type in the Outline view tree of the model.
2. Name the structured data type "Customer".
3. Add the following composite types:

subitem.label: Add an element with name "Id", type "int" and cardinality "Exactly one".
Add an element with name "Name", type "string" and cardinality "Exactly one".
Add an element with name "Email", type "string" and cardinality "Exactly one".
Add an element with name "Product", type "Product" and cardinality "Exactly one".
